adrFormatAddress: 22 E 82nd St C3, New York, NY 10028-0300, USA

originalText.text:
Guy, the technician, arrived on time and installed a new door check on the outer wrought iron lobby entrance gate.  Previous locksmiths and handymen installation never worked satisfactorily.
In this case the closer would not operate if the door was opened more than 70 degrees as it would remain stuck. Placing on the outside rather than the inside made all the difference.   I no longer have to worry about the door remaining open.

originalText.text:
NYC Doors and More did a superb job in repairing the original door of our brownstone in Brooklyn and installing a quiet, reliable self-closing device. They came to our home, sent a reasonable estimate, and performed the work all in a timely manner. We're very pleased with the results and also appreciate their friendliness every step of the way. I cannot recommend them more highly.
Fred R. Park Slope

originalText.text: I had a great experience with DOORS NYC! They helped my small business by being a stockists for me and helping with my social media. Their platform allowed for me to have extensive networking.  I also saw a huge increase in online and in-store sales!

text.text: I had a great experience with DOORS NYC! They helped my small business by being a stockists for me and helping with my social media. Their platform allowed for me to have extensive networking.  I also saw a huge increase in online and in-store sales!

originalText.text:
I called this business to find out if they would be able to realign the entrance door of my cousin's apartment.  I informed them that my cousin was a senior who lives in the Bronx, and that I live in Brooklyn.  I wanted to know, if they could provide me an estimate?  I was asked to submit a video of the door, which I did and provided them my cousin's address. They gave me an estimate that was agreeable to my cousin. I informed them, that I wanted them to give me a time and day, that would be best for all parties to get together at my cousin's apartment.  Days passed and I patiently waited for their response because I didn't want to rush them, in case they were busy.  After letting several days pass and no response from them, I decided to call them. I was told that they would not be able to serve me and my cousin because, they couldn't give me advance notice to meet at my cousin's apartment because they would only be able to fix my cousin's door, spur of the moment, when they happen to have an assignment in the Bronx or in her area. I also realized, they had already dismissed me and my cousin, had I not called, they had no intention of responding.

I was, giving them the courtesy and consideration, but NYC
Doors, unfortunately, could not respond in kind.  They had plenty of time to tell me, that they wouldn't be able to assist me and my cousin. I found this company to be unprofessional, inconsiderate, and not a straightforward company to do business with.
